Operation 'CreateApiKey' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Create API keys' is too generic and plural. Description is comprehensive but lacks clear output details about what is returned. Improved summary specifies singular action with optional scopes. Enhanced description clarifies required/optional inputs, default behavior, return value specifics, and the critical security note about key retrieval only at creation time for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new API Key for the user.**

To create your initial SendGrid API Key, you should [use the SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/api_keys). Once you have created a first key with scopes to manage additional API keys, you can use this API for all other key management.
A JSON request body containing a `name` property is required when making requests to this endpoint. If the number of maximum keys, 100, is reached, a `403` status will be returned.
Though the `name` field is required, it does not need to be unique. A unique API key ID will be generated for each key you create and returned in the response body.
It is not necessary to pass a `scopes` field to the API when creating a key, but you should be aware that omitting the `scopes` field from your request will create a key with "Full Access" permissions by default.
See the [API Key Permissions List](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/how-to-use-the-sendgrid-v3-api/authorization) for all available scopes. An API key's scopes can be updated after creation using the "Update API keys" endpoint.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new API key with optional scopes
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new API key for the authenticated user. Requires a JSON request body with a `name` property (required, does not need to be unique) and optional `scopes` array. If `scopes` is omitted, the key defaults to "Full Access" permissions. Returns the newly created API key object including the unique `api_key_id` and assigned scopes. Maximum of 100 keys per user; returns 403 if limit is exceeded. The returned API key value is only available at creation time.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Create API keys' is too generic and plural. Description is comprehensive but lacks clear output details about what is returned. Improved summary specifies singular action with optional scopes. Enhanced description clarifies required/optional inputs, default behavior, return value specifics, and the critical security note about key retrieval only at creation time for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'UpdateApiKeyName' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Summary is clear and actionable. Description lacks output details about what is returned after the update. Enhanced description specifies the return value and clarifies that only the name is modified while other properties remain unchanged, improving AI agent understanding of the operation's effects.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update the name of an existing API Key.**

You must pass this endpoint a JSON request body with a `name` property, which will be used to rename the key associated with the `api_key_id` passed in the URL.
data.description_suggestion: Updates the name of an existing API key identified by `api_key_id`. Requires a JSON request body with a `name` property. Returns the updated API key object with the new name, ID, and current scopes. Other key properties remain unchanged.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description lacks output details about what is returned after the update. Enhanced description specifies the return value and clarifies that only the name is modified while other properties remain unchanged, improving AI agent understanding of the operation's effects.

message: Operation 'UpdateApiKey' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Summary is clear and actionable. Description comprehensively covers inputs and usage patterns but lacks explicit output details. Enhanced description clarifies the return value and streamlines the explanation of partial update scenarios for better AI agent decision-making about which endpoint to use.

data.current_summary: Update API key name and scopes
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update the name and scopes of a given API key.**

You must pass this endpoint a JSON request body with a `name` field and a `scopes` array containing at least one scope. The `name` and `scopes` fields will be used to update the key associated with the `api_key_id` in the request URL.

If you need to update a key's scopes only, pass the `name` field with the key's existing name; the `name` will not be modified. If you need to update a key's name only, use the "Update API key name" endpoint.

See the [API Key Permissions List](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/how-to-use-the-sendgrid-v3-api/authorization) for all available scopes.
data.description_suggestion: Updates the name and/or scopes of an existing API key identified by `api_key_id`. Requires a JSON request body with `name` (string) and `scopes` (array with at least one scope). To update only scopes, provide the existing name unchanged. To update only the name, use the "Update API key name" endpoint instead. Returns the updated API key object with the new name, scopes, and ID.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description comprehensively covers inputs and usage patterns but lacks explicit output details. Enhanced description clarifies the return value and streamlines the explanation of partial update scenarios for better AI agent decision-making about which endpoint to use.

message: Operation 'DeleteApiKey' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary uses 'Delete' (plural, generic) instead of 'Revoke' (domain-specific, singular). Description lacks output details and doesn't clearly communicate the irreversible nature of the operation. Enhanced summary uses domain-appropriate terminology. Enhanced description specifies the HTTP response code, clarifies the permanent side effects, and emphasizes the need to create a new key if access is needed again, critical for AI agent understanding of operation consequences.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to revoke an existing API Key using an `api_key_id`**

Authentications using a revoked API Key will fail after after some small propogation delay. If the API Key ID does not exist, a `404` status will be returned.
data.description_suggestion: Revokes an existing API key identified by `api_key_id`, permanently disabling it. Authentications using the revoked key will fail after a brief propagation delay. Returns a 204 No Content response on success. Returns 404 if the API key ID does not exist. This action cannot be undone; a new API key must be created if needed.
data.reasoning: Summary uses 'Delete' (plural, generic) instead of 'Revoke' (domain-specific, singular). Description lacks output details and doesn't clearly communicate the irreversible nature of the operation. Enhanced summary uses domain-appropriate terminology. Enhanced description specifies the HTTP response code, clarifies the permanent side effects, and emphasizes the need to create a new key if access is needed again, critical for AI agent understanding of operation consequences.
